Fields.DialogueText: Captain, reports of Morgana sightings.
Sound the alarm.
@BATTLE
Red sky by night, sailor's delight. Red sky by morning...
Fusō. What are you up to?
Kanchou. I was just watching the sky.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't it beautiful?
I can tell you enjoy nature.
Don't worry yourself about astronomical concepts. We've got a war to fight.

Fields.DialogueText: I love the colors that paint the sky.
We should respect the natural world around us. It's just the right motive in life.
You should stop every once in a while to smell the roses, Kanchou.
Don't stay out here too long or you'll get sick. It's supposed to be rather cold later.
You know me by now. I never stay out too long.
Now that you mention it, I don't recall seeing you out after dark very often. That's odd, isn't it?
Odd? Maybe...
Well, no worry. See you later.
See you, Kanchou.
Red sky by night, sailor's delight. Red sky by morning...
Sailor's warning.
Kanchou. A report came in. It's not good.
What happened?
Some of our comrades have been defeated. They were attacked not too far west of us, further into the Pacific... in the middle of the night.

Fields.MenuText: We've never been sure that the Morganas' vision isn't better than ours in the dark. It could become a problem.
Such things do happen, Fusō. It is very unfortunate.
Darkness won't stop us. We'll fight them to our last breath, if that's what's needed.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't like it any more than you do, Kanchou, but I'm sure it's nothing we can't overcome.
It's just so sad.
Kanchou... you're very committed. I believe in you.
The Morganas in this area had concentrated their recent attacks during the day, but it may be they're changing course. We'll have to make preparations, changes in sleep schedules...
Kanchou, that sounds grueling.
Fusō, would you like the honor of first shift?
No, no, thank you. I haven't been sleeping well, and... well, please, no.
Well, that's decisive. Fair enough, though - we'll work out your schedule later.
If we're lucky, they won't change their strategy. At least not yet.
@BATTLE
Good day, Kanchou. How was your first night shift? I imagine it was enjoyable.

Fields.MenuText: It was boring, honestly.
It wasn't so bad. I took a nice walk and relaxed.
*Yawn* I'm so tired.

Fields.DialogueText: Did you expect anything different?
Hmm, that sounds actually sounds quite pleasant.
Oh no! Do you think you can get some time off for a nap?
Well, I did discover one thing out there. The stars are very beautiful.
Are they? Seems the sky is always cloudy whenever I'm up at night. Which isn't very often...
So, when's your night shift?
I can't remember... sorry. Now, would you look at the time? I have to go do something.
... Yeah, that's going to come back to bite us somehow.
If the Morganas don't bite us first...
@BATTLE
Fusō, you still awake?
Yeah, I was just writing for a little bit.
Anything worth sharing?
Maybe this one.
Sky falling across...
The snow-covered mountain...
As the sparrow crows.

Fields.MenuText: That's an insightful poem, Fusō.
Hmm, I don't think I get it.
It sounds lovely, Fusō.

Fields.DialogueText: I like to sit and think about home... I try to keep it simple.
Well, at the surface, I hope you find it to be nice and soothing.
Thank you, Kanchou. You know, I appreciate that you would take the time to listen.
Well, I'm going to get some sleep soon. All of these all-nighters are putting me on edge. By the way, when's your shift?
It's coming up... I promise.
Well, good night.
@BATTLE
Still having trouble sleeping?
Look who's asking.
... Fair enough.
Fusō, I noticed the other night, you never turned your light off. Were you up all night?
No, Kanchou, I actually... well, I slept with the light on.
Oh. Is that common? Some people fall asleep reading with the light still on.
No, well, I've almost always done it. I suppose... I have a little fear. Kanchou, I have an irrational fear of the dark.

Fields.MenuText: And you're how old now?
I understand. I think everyone has a few irrational fears.
Hmm, that is quite rare. I'm genuinely surprised.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm too old to have it still be a problem, I know.
Kanchou, I don't think you understand the embarrassment this causes me.
Kanchou, are you being sarcastic?
Well, at least now I understand why you haven't signed up for a night shift. Listen, if this is going to be a problem, then we need to...
No, I didn't mean to say I wouldn't... I'll sign up right now!
Maybe hold off for just a bit. There are a few Morganas headed this way.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, you really don't need to check on me. I promise I'm fine. My first round on night watch will go flawlessly when it happens.
Oh, I believe you - and I'll leave if you'd rather be alone. But if you don't mind the company...
A little bit of both, I guess? Sometimes I'll stay up a little late reading poetry or something similar, to avoid turning the light off.

Fields.MenuText: You should have told me. I could have helped you come up with some solution.
You're going to have to face that fear sooner or later, you know.
No sleep? I don't know how you do it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure there is a solution to this sort of problem.
Well, we Belles are different than humans, you know. Our dependence on sleep varies.
Well, with that being said...
*ALARM*
A surprise attack?
I didn't think it'd be this soon.
Well, we know what to do.
@BATTLE
Not at all! But, trust me, you don't have to worry about me falling asleep on the job.
Just in general, or do you have difficulty sleeping because of the dark?
So your first night shift is coming up, huh?
Yeah, it is.

Fields.MenuText: Just pretend that the dark is a Morgana. And since no Morgana can stand a chance against you, the darkness shouldn't be able to either.
You're brave, Fusō. I have no doubt you can face this.
It'll get easier to be up and around at night, I swear.

Fields.DialogueText: Such thinking will probably only lead to me developing a fear of Funayūrei.
You might be the only one...
If you say so, Kanchou...
Well, good luck to you.
Will you do me a favor, Kanchou? Could you... join me for the shift? At least for a little while, until I have some time to acclimate myself?
I'll see if my schedule allows for it. Make sure I don't have any late meetings.
Thanks, Kanchou. I'd really like the help.
Of course, Fusō.
@BATTLE
Kanchou. My shift will be starting soon. Ready for our night walk?
*Yawn* I think so. Remember, this is a job, not a stroll.
I know that. Still, it's nice to have someone around. I really do appreciate your help.
Well, then, Fusō, let's get going.
So far, so good. This isn't so bad.

Fields.MenuText: You're doing well so far.
It's just that dark out. Look, there's the moon.
I told you it's no big deal.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you for having confidence in me, Kanchou. I do appreciate it.
Oh, would you look at that. Wow, that sure does look nice.
Maybe for you, Kanchou, but not for me. It's so dark and mysterious...
Come on, let's walk around the ship. We've got a long night ahead...
Sounds good to me. By the way, is that light out there normal?
Light?
Yes, right there. Out at sea. I didn't think we were close to a lighthouse.
That's no lighthouse... good eye, Fusō. Sound the alarms.
@BATTLE
There's several ships out there, Kanchou.
I'm not aware of anyone who's supposed to be out here but us...
I think the enemy would disagree.
@BATTLE
Now, it's been a few days, and I don't think I like these night battles. First, everything is silent... and then it's... KA-BOOM.
I take your point - though at least they don't have nighttime air superiority. Yet.
Surely the attacks can't continue at this pace for too long, can they?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure. If they do, I fear for the crew's morale.
Well, no matter what, we have to remain strong to make it through.
I just can't stand this. We need to do something about it.

Fields.DialogueText: I can try to think of ways to help us out, if you like. Maybe we can implement a reward for those who take extra shifts? Maybe taking them from me?
Kanchou, I am confident that we're strong enough. I know it.
As much as I don't like it, what can we do? We're at the mercy of those Morganas. Funayūrei. Whatever.
Whatever the cost is, we have to defeat them.
*Yawn* I know. I feel like we can't do it unless we get more sleep.
Have you been sleeping at all?
Maybe. Sometimes. Listen, I know this is a little awkward to ask, but do you think I could sleep in your cabin? I read that it may help.
... Fine. But I don't keep the lights on.
Morganas moving in fast. Alert the crew.
@BATTLE
It's sort of like we're roommates, eh, Kanchou?
Well, that's one way of putting it.
How would you put it?

Fields.MenuText: Probably more like "I'm watching your back," or something.
Maybe more like we're helping each other out?
Hmm... now that I think of it, it is like being roommates.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, now, don't get stingy with me, Kanchou.
Yes. Sometimes, you remind me of my sister. Fierce and devoted.
Kind of brings you back to sharing dormitories in basic training, right?
Now, Fusō, I'm going to turn off the light. Will you relax?
I'll try.
*CLICK*
Turn it back on.
What's wrong?
I thought I heard something.
Fusō, that was me.
Oh. Well, can we leave this side's light on?
You're just lucky that we don't have to pay for an electric bill, Fusō...
The sky really did look beautiful the other night.
I must have missed it. But I know the moon was out.
You know what else? It's been some time since the Morganas attacked us at night.
Wait a second. Kanchou. Do you believe in coincidences?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, why?
No, why?
Just spit it out.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I don't. There may be some connection between these Funayūrei attacks and the moon's phases.
I have a hunch that the Funayūrei are using the moon's phases to time their attacks.
Oh. I have an idea... the Funayūrei... the moon's phases... it's a little complicated.
The moon, you say? You might be onto something now, Fusō.
Kanchou, permission to delve further? I'd like to chart some research.
Permission granted. But work on it later. We have some Morganas headed this direction.
@BATTLE
Fusō, any luck with those charts?
Not much yet, Kanchou. I've done some mapping, though. Take a look.

Fields.MenuText: This is impressive. Great work.
It's a good start - we'll have figured those Morganas out in no time.
Hmm... I don't really understand it.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. You know, this is my first time making maps.
I'm tracking their coordinates as we speak.
A kanchou who can't understand maps? Blasphemy.
Do you know what cycle of the moon we're at tonight?
It's a waning moon right now. I'm predicting something coming soon.
During the new moon, perhaps?
I think so. All we need to know now is where they'll strike.
@BATTLE
Fusō, I've contacted the navigator. He'll be leading us in the right direction. Soon we'll have those Morganas cornered.
I hope so, Kanchou. I just wonder whether my calculations are correct.
Do you have any particular reason to think they're not?
I'm not a navigator. I'm not a scientist. I don't know anything about lunar phases. I'm just here, doing what I can do to help you out.

Fields.MenuText: That's all we can ask from anyone, Fusō.
But you're a quick study. I'm impressed by everything you've put together here.
Well, what's the worst that could happen?

Fields.DialogueText: I like being nice, Kanchou. It's in my nature.
I've learned that, no matter what you know, if you apply yourself, you can accomplish anything.
The worst is that I'm completely wrong, and endanger us all...
Well, for what it's worth, I think you're on to something here. It's my idea to push forward with it just as much as it is yours.
Thank you, Kanchou. Now, if we look at the charts, we can anticipate the Funayūrei will be moving south. By charting this course, we can intercept them.
Great. Let's set sail.
@BATTLE
Fusō, report to the bridge! Crew to your battle stations!
@BATTLE
So. That could have gone better.

Fields.MenuText: It also could have been a lot worse, you know?
Hey, being off by a few leagues isn't so bad. I think your hypothesis is holding up reasonably well.
I think it's time to re-check our sources and identify what to do next.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess you may be right, Kanchou. We did survive, and we have more data than we did.
That is true. I need to stay positive. I'll review my notes.
I'm sorry. I'll work harder next time.
I think it's time to rethink strategy.
Well, we could try to force the Funayūrei to fight only during the day. See if it might disrupt their plans.
Daytime battles, you say?
I know, I know. So much of it is beyond our control.
Listen - you've been working hard, and I really do appreciate it. Why don't you take the rest of the day off?
Thanks, Kanchou. Maybe I just need a little rest.
But Kanchou, just waiting for them to come out of the dark...
I know. Believe me.
Kanchou, you're awake?
Fusō, hey. I didn't notice you over there.
You know, I haven't said lately how appreciative I am of the way you look out for everyone on board this ship.
What do you mean?
There are many who lead who are, well, rude. Always yelling, working their crews too hard. Nothing is ever "good enough." You've been nothing like that.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I figure if we're to stand a chance of defeating the Morganas, the crew needs all the support I can give.
Some captains work that way. But I don't. I see that kindness is how you get the best from other people.
I think you're giving me too much credit.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, of course.
And I'm so happy that's so.
Ha! Of course you do, Kanchou. But, respectfully, you're wrong.
Right. Now, I'm going to shut the lights off. Are you going to be okay?
If you're with me, I think I will be.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, there's news. The Funayūrei made another night raid - this time in the Bay of Manado.
I saw. Their targeting seems to have been atrocious, at least - they're not that much better in the dark than we are.
The problem is that we don't know when or where they'll attack next time. I hate this feeling of being on edge at all hours.
I think it's time to implement a new operation. If we can't hunt this group down, we'll lure them out.
You have a plan, Kanchou?
I have an idea, at least. But if it works, we may be in for a hell of a fight.
Are you ready, Fusō?
Hai!
@BATTLE
They're spreading terror all the same.
Fusō? We're scouting locations for our operation - are you free to offer some input?
Now? Kanchou, isn't it too dark to see anything useful?
It's not so bad. And part of the point is to familiarize ourselves with the terrain at night, after all.
It's just dark out, Fusō. It's nothing we can't handle together.

Fields.MenuText: And did I mention there's a nice breeze?
Besides, if Morganas show up...
And I'd much rather be talking to you than to nervous midshipmen.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess I didn't mind it last time.
Ah.
Ha! Flatterer!
Join me?
Of course, Kanchou.
Though I'm afraid the scouting may have to wait...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I think it's time to explain myself. I have dreams sometimes.
Does it involve darkness?
Yes. In this dream, I was a child. I lived on the edge of a forest, and would play in the woods at night.
One night, I walked out, but this time I stopped for a moment because I heard my sister crying. I didn't think much of it, though, so after a few moments I continued.
I only took a few more steps when I noticed two eyes gazing out at me from the depths of the forest. Big, yellow eyes, like flaming stars bursting from between the trees.
Sorry, is this too much?
No, please continue.
I ran back toward home, screaming for Yamashiro to run. To just go out as far as she could in the dark and hide.
But they've been getting worse lately when I've been on my own. And... well, obviously, I've been having problems with the dark.

Fields.MenuText: Wow, that's something else, Fusō.
Have you ever talked to Yamashiro about these dreams?
Fusō, it's okay. It was just a dream. Monsters aren't real.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sorry I never said anything before, Kanchou.
She just tells me to ignore them. She's... stronger than I am in some ways.
There are monsters, Kanchou. Morganas are monsters.
Fusō, you can't let this dream control you. You have to conquer it.
I know, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Let's go.
@BATTLE
Not happy dreams, I take it.
No.
No, they take different... well, different things happen, but the point is usually the same.
... Maybe I should start with the latest one.
And then something tore into me. Or, really, tore me in half. I knew I was dying, and everything around me was catching on fire.
These dreams... we're not always in the forest. We're not even always human.
And Yamashiro's trying as hard as she can to get away - I can't even see her anymore - but it doesn't matter. She's going to die too.
But it's always night - maybe close to dawn but not there yet - and it's always fire. And I'm hit with something and I can't move and I know it's the end.
And I know my last thought, my very last thought, is that I couldn't save her, and Japan is undefended, and... and then I wake up and I can't breathe.
Does this happen often? The nights you've crashed in my quarters haven't seemed...
I don't have the nightmares when you're around.
Okay.
It's getting dark.
The sky sets purple...
Waves roll along and shimmer...
As we rise today.
Did you just write that?
Yes. How did it sound?

Fields.MenuText: What does it mean?
It was beautiful.
It reminds me of myself.

Fields.DialogueText: I like to make poetry that reflects our personal meanings within nature. That's what I was trying for, at least.
You should try writing poetry sometimes. It's soothing.
I wonder why, Kanchou...
Will you stay out late after dark?
Yes, at your command, Kanchou.
I didn't command you. I was just asking.
I'll still be there.
@BATTLE
I've completed my second chart, Kanchou. Take a look.
Well, I still don't know much about lunar cycles, but I'll give it a look. Oh, and Fusō...
Yes, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad you told me about your dream the other night.
Do you think the Morganas remind you of the monster from your dream?
Does your sister know about your fear of the dark?

Fields.DialogueText: I feel relieved that I've finally told someone about it. It's taken a weight of my chest.
You know, they both have similarities. Both come in the night... but I think the monster represents something different.
No. Nobody knows. You're the first person I've told.
... Listen. For whatever it's worth...
*ALARM*
What? They weren't supposed to come now. Look at the charts. The charts!
We'll update the charts later. We've got a war to fight.
@BATTLE
That looks to be the end of that wave... for now.
We're going to make it. I'm determined.

Fields.MenuText: Fusō, you seem... different.
Fusō, I really like your spirit today.
Fusō, you have conquered your fears.

Fields.DialogueText: Different? Well, I am more eager, and I feel... well, lighter.
My spirit? Well, I am ready to fight.
I don't know if I've gotten there yet. Little steps, Kanchou, little steps.
Let's check the charts. When do you anticipate the next strike?
Well, I think it should start within the next few days... and if so, the strike would be somewhere around here.
You mean that harbor?
Yeah. Civilians could be hurt.
Not if we give the Morganas another target. I've been rounding up damaged boats from Samarinda to Ujungpandang.
If we set out a decoy flotilla of half-ruined ships where we know the Morganas are going to be...
You think they'll go for it?
They're not very discerning at the best of times. And, y'know, if they insist on hunting in the dark...
Oh, hell. What happened to the charts?
Stragglers, Kanchou. Don't let your guard down...
@BATTLE
Let's get going, Fusō. We need to rally the crew.
I'm on it. We've been drilling all day - when the trap springs, the crew will be ready.
Great work. We couldn't do this without you, you know.
Thank you Kanchou. It's been an honor...  no, wait, a pleasure... to serve.

Fields.MenuText: Fusō, when this war is over, I'm going to miss being by your side.
We've been excellent partners, don't you think?
It's time for us to shine. I trust you, Fusō. I really do.

Fields.DialogueText: I-I'm going to miss being with you too, Kanchou.
Yes, Kanchou. We have been.
I trust you too, Kanchou, more than anyone I have before.
Now, let's take on those Morganas.
All crew, get ready. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
The good news is that, as far as we can tell, the largest Morgana group in the region scattered after our little trap. We've even had reports that the damaged ones are turning on each other.
But they're not gone.
Not all of them, no. Are you up for a little more excitement?
I'm with you until the end, Kanchou.
I know.
And, listen, I don't want to make light of your nightmares - but I promise you, when monsters come out of the dark in real life, I'll be here to help you fight them off.
So... what's that you're holding onto?
A poem.

Fields.MenuText: Can I read it?
I love your poetry.
Put down the pen so we can talk, Fusō.

Fields.DialogueText: Not yet, Kanchou. Maybe when the war's over...
Oh, Kanchou. I didn't know I had a fan.
Well, I can express myself both ways, can't I?
We make a good team, don't we?
Yes. Now let's go off on more adventures. Day or night, I'm ready to go.
@BATTLE
Kanchou... arigatōgozaimashita!
Yes, what is it?
Morganas have been spotted, Captain.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I just got a report in from HQ. They're seeing a decline in the number of Funayūrei attacks in the area.
That... strongly suggests our plan worked. I'm so proud of you, Fusō.
What? Please, Kanchou, no - it was all of us.

Fields.MenuText: Yes, but we couldn't have done it without you.
Fusō, are you joking? This was all your plan.
Well, let's give credit where credit is due. I guess since I'm the captain, that's my boon, but I do have a good crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, my skills are good, but not that good.
No, Kanchou, this was your plan, remember? I just drew the maps.
A good crew, huh? I'm happy to be a part of such a distinguished group.
Now that we won't have to fight so many battles at night, will you be okay?
You know, maybe I'll still take some walks, you know, just to make sure I feel comfortable. Care to join me?
Sure. Just name the time and place.
It's a date.
Kanchou. Are you here?
Yes, Fusō, I was just rinsing my face.
Are you ready for our "date?"

Fields.MenuText: You keep calling it that. Why?
Just one more second and I'll be ready. I didn't think you'd be in such a rush.
Yes, I'm ready for our "date." I'm just "freshening up."

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it's just the two of us, out for a stroll on a ship on a pleasant evening...
We're burning moonlight. It won't be dark forever.
You're fresh enough, Kanchou, I've seen you at your best and worst. Now come on out.
All right, all right, I'm ready. Let's go.
You were right, Kanchou. The stars out here... they're gorgeous.
You don't see stars like this out on the mainland.
When I see them, sometimes I think of these bright lights - like those eyes from that beast in the dream.
Is it scary?
Not any more. I see the great, fearsome power of the beast. And I see the bright beauty of the stars, piercing through the darkness.
I think it's the beauty in nature that's trying to push its way to be seen.
Whether good or bad, nature finds its way through light.
Fusō?
Yes, Kanchou?
You're holding my hand.
I'd like to keep holding it, if that's all right.
Take your time.
